stimulus:
In this experiment, you will be presented with 8 scenarios, which you must read carefully.

After reading each scenario, you will be prompted two comprehension questions: a multiple choice question and a brief open answer question. You will be required to answer both questions for every scenario, meaning 16 questions in total.

To begin the experiment, hit the space bar.

response.Explanation: I don't think alice is being sarcastic necessarily. she is being insincere as she does not really love olivia's hair and wants her to have different hair so it is a disingenuous comment rather than a sarcastic one. she probably is lying and saying she loves her hair as she doesn't want to hurt olivia's feelings
catherine's message is not sarcastic as it is not mean-spirited. it is just hyperbole as although she could not literally lift a cow she is sincere in expressing how good she feels
the text may be a joke in sarcasm saying he is sweet despite the salt. if they are long term close friends then sometimes sarcastic jokes are okay
margaret is being honest about her reaction to the dog so it isnt sarcasm, julia may not react well but at least margaret is sincere
eric would not have known about philip's conversation with his coworker as he was not there. so as far as eric knows the compliment is sincere
david may think this is sarcasm as he has seen them fighting recently
kevin would interpret ana's comment as sincere as she genuinely believes this and as her close friend kevin would know this

Elizabeth would interpret May's text as sincere as to her knowledge may is being sincere as she did enjoy the trip despite what she has recently found out about Kate. just because she knows that kate is unavailable doesnt mean the trip was bad
